availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, clerk and merchant. Bourbon County native. Son of Allen Bashford and Lucy Bashford. Married to Mary E. Rowland Bashford in Bourbon County on February 6, 1861. Father of Milton Bashford, Lucy Bashford, and Rowland Bashford. Clerk in Bourbon County in 1860. Merchant in Bourbon County in 1863. Owned two enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, p. 11.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, p. 3.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Bourbon County, KY, July 1863, p. 2 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film #000183089.
Find A Grave, "Allen Bashford (1832-1894)," Memorial #91409992, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/91409992 (accessed March 15, 2017).
